sentence.Network_en: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.
sentence.Network_cn: 所以你们要将心里的污秽除掉, 不可再硬着颈项.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French circonciser, or from Latin circumcis- 'cut around', from the verb circumcidere, from circum 'around, about' + caedere 'to cut'

entry.tran: 对(男孩或男子)行割礼;环割…的包皮
entry.def: If a boy or man is circumcised, the loose skin at the end of his penis is cut off.

example.ex: He had been circumcised within eight days of birth as required by Jewish law.
example.tran: 根据犹太法律的规定，他在出生后8天内接受了割礼。

entry.tran: 对(女孩或妇女)行割礼;为…切除部分(或全部)阴蒂
entry.def: In some cultures, if a girl or woman is circumcised, her clitoris is cut or cut off.

example.ex: An estimated number of 90 to 100 million women around the world living today have been circumcised.
example.tran: 当今世界上，约有9,000万到1亿的女性接受过割礼。

means.word_mean: 1. cut the skin over the clitoris
2. cut the foreskin off male babies or teenage boys;

sentences.sentence: "During the bris, the baby boy is circumcised"

auth_sentence.content: They are going to start to circumcise, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are going to start to circumcise, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are going to start to circumcise, he said.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+cise切开,杀→把[没用的东西]全部切掉
de加强+cise切开,杀+ive……的→adj.决定性的
incise[v.切,切割]+ive……的→切人的→一针见血的
pre预先+cise切开,杀→预先切好→精确的
excise[v.割去,删去]+ion动作或状态→n.删除,灭绝;切除
incise[v.切,切割]+or物→切[咬]东西的东西→incisor门牙
precise[adj.精确的,清楚的]+ion表名词→n.精密,正确
